intro: Eriogonum henricksonii, commonly known as the Henry's ghostflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family and is characterized by its small, pale blue to white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly habitats, often in dry, open areas. Its leaves are simple and often have a bluish-gray hue, contributing to its drought-resistant adaptations. Eriogonum henricksonii is a short-lived perennial that plays a role in stabilizing soils in its arid environment.
